comment: Given some real number ` B ` where ` A ` acts like a right additive identity, derive that ` A ` is a left additive identity. Note that the hypothesis is weaker than proving that ` A ` is a right additive identity (for all numbers). Although, if there is a right additive identity, then by ~ readdcan , ` A ` is the right additive identity. (Contributed by Steven Nguyen, 14-Jan-2023.)
